newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS-New IPOs price below expectations.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS-New IPOs price below expectations.

text.p: All four companies making their initial public offering debuts on Wednesday managed to hang onto their IPO prices, but at least three of the companies priced shares below expectations.

Shares of Scoop Inc moved up 3/8 from their IPO price of $4.50 a share. The 1.3 million shares had been estimated to price between $5 and $6 each. The Santa Ana, Calif., company can send information to Internet users based on their customized needs.
Other companies that made their IPO debuts:
-- Peregrine Systems edged up 1/4 to 9-1/4. The company had cut both the number of shares to be offered and the estimated price range ahead of the IPO.
-- Meade Instruments Corp shares edged up 1/2 to 7-1/2. The shares priced at $7, below their estimated range of $8 to $10.
-- Nexar Technologies Inc shares were flat at $9.
